page.title: 04WIVELISCOMBE FESTIVAL
page.content: Wiveliscombe Festival carries on the tradition begun 65 years ago although riding and wrestling contests were noted in 1753.12 years ago a committee was set up to raise money for repairs to the Constitutional Rooms.With the addition of a new kitchen,cloakrooms and external improvements the building became the new Community Centre,the cost Â£20000.Several loans obtained from Taunton Deane and Somerset County Councils are being repaid from Festival funds and donations from local organisations.The festival's special theme in '85 was the Monmouth Rebellion,300 years ago 6 Wiveliscombe rebels were killed at the Battle of Sedgemoor and 3 Wellington men hung in the town to deter others.Costumed children played traditional games and danced in the Square.A witch was ducked and a banquet and market held.
